description: Mark Allison continues the series, turning attention to notifications which are the primary mechanism for updating the user and providing easy access to information.

description: Dan Lew shares some useful tips about all the strings that need to be localized in an Android app.

description: In view of the fact that on Saturday we celebrate Programmer Day, Paweł Gajda decided to write a simple app for this event in Android Platform using Kotlin.
title: Programmers day Android app in Kotlin

description: With Android L, Google has forced that only PIE (Position-independent executable) will be supported on Android and this article explains how developers can create PIE executables.
title: Compiling native libraries for Android L

description: Instagram Engineering has released an annotation processor that automatically generates the JSON stream parsing code for huge speed increases over Jackson ObjectMapper or others.
title: Fast, auto-generated streaming JSON parsing for Android

description: Keeping data in sync with the cloud is an important part of many applications, and the Google I/O App is no exception. Bruno Oliveira, tech lead of the 2014 Google I/O mobile app, describes the approaches taken in the implementation.
title: Conference Data Sync and GCM in the Google I/O App

description: In this second post of the series, Dave Smith adds support for a few additional features to the custom LayoutManager that the average adapter-based view is expected to have.
title: Building a RecyclerView LayoutManager – Part 2

description: Qualcomm® SnapdragonTM Performance Visualizer is a comprehensive software suite designed to give you deep-dive visibility into system resources, allowing you to optimize application performance. This helps make it easier to pinpoint and resolve performance bottlenecks so your apps run at peak levels.
title: Gain more visibility to boost app performance

description: Wouldn’t it be nice if you could easily provide the spec values as input and get it rendered on top of your UI for comparison? Enter dspec, a super simple way to define UI specs that can be rendered on top of Android UIs.

description: Android Studio 0.8.10 has been released to the canary channel. While primarily focusing on bug fixes, there are some notable new features, including a new memory monitor, increased speed and accuracy of Analyze > Inspect Code, and a few new Lint checks.
title: Android Studio 0.8.10 Released
